boardgame.name: 18EU
boardgame.description: 18EU is an 18xx title which depicts a century of European railroading from the 1830s to the 1930s. It shares much in common with other 18xx titles, but also includes 15 minor companies. They are auctioned before the game starts, then pay 50/50 dividend (Minor/Owner) and finally merge to form corporations. Another special element are bonuses for completing long runs between off-map areas, that can affect huge incomes in the end game. The map stretches from France to Austria and Poland, and from northern Germany to middle Italy and features the Alps as mountains (higher tile laying costs). The game is played in sets of two operating rounds, where the railroads are built, followed by one stock round, where shares are bought and sold._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The general idea of all 18xx titles is holding shares of railway companies, building railroads by laying hex-tiles, running trains and generating income paid out as dividend. The special thing (and difference to other games) is the difference between the players_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;acute; private money and the money in the companies_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;acute; treasuries. In the end the player, who managed to acquire the biggest private fortune, wins the game!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: This is *not* a DTG games version, it is from a late version of the prototype files posted before DTG began selling copies. Includes everything needed to play (except money), everything is laminated in 5mil. 2-part box included.
Never shrinkwrapped as Deep Thought doesn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t do that, but new never played. Seller pays exact shipping.

This game is used, but is in generally good condition. It is ready to play. It does not come with paper money. I bought it from DTG as a manual cut game, but I had DTG laminate/cut the tiles. I laminated the certificates (5mil gloss) and charters (3mil gloss). The box may have some shelf wear. Shipping cost for the first game is $12 and $5 more for each additional game. International shipping quote by request.
Unassembled game kit from DeepThoughtGames. Complete. Box in good shape.
Reserved for Butterflyy0038 Closet Clearance Auction

New, unplayed Deep Though Games. - 2pc box - Board: mounted, realistic borders, multicolor - Tiles, trains, certificates, etc: laminated, die-cut - Tokens: wood, mounted labels - No money - Ready to play!
Deep Thought Games edition, with all the bells and whistles _except_ no money. Reserved for user 3dicebombers.

New as it came from DeepThoughtGames long ago, but never played. I can send you pictures of the components. 2-piece sturdy box. Mounted map. Tiles cut and laminated. Charters uncut, trains uncut, certificates uncut. Wooden tokens (labels, included, need to be applied). No play money included.

[size=14][b][u]Comments:[/u][/b][/size] To see other titles that I have for sale (and perhaps mitigate shipping costs) enter the following into your browser: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/Paladin82Y . Note that I am not a store but just a gamer like you (although one that lost his mind and purchased waaaay too many games over the years). I have tried to accurately describe my offerings from a gamer_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s perspective. If you are a collector or re-seller and need more details, just let me know. [size=14][b][u]Condition Notes:[/u][/b][/size] Smoke-free home. This version was not distributed in shrinkwrap. But is unplayed and partially punched/cut. [b][u]Edition Notes:[/u][/b] English. This is the professionally published version from Deep Thought Games (from back before their backlog went to years). Includes a mounted map on foam board; pre-cut laminated track tiles; uncut charters, stock certificates, and trains; and token labels. Paper money is not included (although if you need paper money, this title is probably not a good choice for you). See my separate listing for poker chips if you need some. [size=14][b][u]Shipping Notes:[/u][/b][/size] I am willing to meet you at one of the many local Game Nights close to Waukee, IA (see https://www.boardgamegeek.com/guild/1365) to make the exchange in person which would reduce your shipping cost to $0.00. Otherwise--Yes, I will gladly combine orders to reduce your per-item shipping costs. (To see other items to add to your order see http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/Paladin82Y). When placing an order, please provide a contact phone number--this is ONLY in case there are shipping issues--I am NOT planning to call you. Also, please provide a direct/external (non-BGG) email address. Finally, if at all possible, please provide a business (rather than a residential) shipping address and let me know that the address you are providing is a business address (this may expedite delivery). [size=14][b][u]Payment Notes:[/u][/b][/size] **Note that the listed offered price includes a small discount for a cash (cash, money order, Amazon Gift Card, western union) payment. [b][i]US buyers:[/i][/b] When placing the order, let me know if you would like to purchase the optional insurance offered by the shipping company. I cannot remember ever having any material problems, but theoretically there is some risk. If the receiver (you) does NOT request (and does NOT pay extra for) insurance (decision is totally up to you) then the receiver (you) agrees to assume responsibility for lost or damaged packages. I know that this paragraph sounds scary, but my lawyer makes me include this -- again, this is probably a non-issue -- I have never had a package that I shipped go missing and think that I have had two people mention extremely minor blemishes incurred during shipping in the last 600 BGG items that I have shipped. See the [i][b]Info from Seller[/b][/i] Section below for more critically important details on payment options.
[b][i]non-US buyers:[/i][/b] See the [i][b]Info from Seller[/b][/i] Section below for more critically important details on shipping and payment options.

US shipping is $13.50. The game is ready to play with a quad-fold mounted board and is fully laminated and is prepared except stickers need to be mounted to the wood tokens. All games come without any paper money and players must supply a bank. Ships with other games offered by All-Aboard Games upon request (see website).
